Trim up an excel worksheet - usually during import

Source: R/import.R
fpr_sheet_trim.Rd

Select column names based on first row with inputs all across. Trim up the dataframe based on whether there are events in the first column. This is a `date` in the pscis inputs and `reference_number` in the fish submission template

Usage

fpr_sheet_trim(
  dat,
  col_filter_na = FALSE,
  col_filter_na_num = 2,
  row_empty_remove = F
)

Arguments

dat

Dataframe

col_filter_na

Logical whether to remove rows if `NA` is present in a specified column. Defaults to false.

col_filter_na_num

Integer specifying column to filter if `NA`s are present. Defaults to 2 because we use that in the fish submission form since `gazetted_name` is required and because first column of location sheet (`step_1_ref_and_loc_info') is populated to row 1500 out of box. Note that this !is.na for col 2 results in some trimming of a couple events on the admin_only_pick_lists.csv

row_empty_remove

Logical on whether to remove empty dataframe rows until the first complete one is found in order to select as rownames. Needs to be turned to TRUE for `fpr_import_hab_con` to work.

Value

A dataframe

On this page
